meanings.definition: Somewhat dim or not very bright in light
meanings.sent1: The room had a dimmish glow from the nightlight.
meanings.sent2: The candle cast a dimmish light in the dark room.
meanings.sent3: The dimmish light made it hard to read the book.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the event was dimmish, like a fading photograph.
meanings.sent5: The dimmish stars twinkled faintly in the night sky.

meanings.sent1: The blurry photo was dimmish and hard to make out.
meanings.sent2: His dimmish handwriting made it difficult to read the note.
meanings.sent3: The dimmish sound of the distant music added to the mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her dimmish recollection of the dream left her puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The dimmish outline of the figure in the fog was eerie.

meanings.definition: To make or become dimmer or less bright
meanings.sent1: She tried to dimmish the lights to create a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The sunset slowly dimmished over the horizon.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally dimmished the screen brightness on his phone.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds dimmished the sunlight, casting shadows.
meanings.sent5: The magician dimmished the stage lights for a dramatic effect.
